content.desc: A handwritten letter by Albert Einstein rejecting religion has been auctioned for almost $3m (£2.3m). In the letter, the theoretical physicist outlines his thoughts on religion and his own Jewish identity. “This remarkably candid, private letter was written a year before Einstein’s death and remains the most fully articulated expression of his religious and philosophical views,” a statement from Christie’s auction house in New York said.
